com.github.cwilper.fcrepo.dto.core.io
Interface ContentHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultContentHandler
public interface ContentHandler

Callback interface used to handle content if needed when inline managed content is encountered while reading a FedoraObject from a stream.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Releases all resources associated with this handler.
 OutputStream handleContent(FedoraObject obj, Datastream ds, DatastreamVersion dsv)
          Handles the content of the given DatastreamVersion.
 

Method Detail

handleContent

OutputStream handleContent(FedoraObject obj,
                           Datastream ds,
                           DatastreamVersion dsv)
                           throws IOException
Handles the content of the given DatastreamVersion.

An implementation MAY:

  • Modify the fields of the given FedoraObject, Datastream, or DatastreamVersion.
  • Opt out of having the content stored, in which case it should return null.

A typical implementation of this method will allocate a file to which the content may be written, set the datastream version's content location to the URI of that file, and return an OutputStream so the caller may write the content.

Parameters:
obj - the object containing the datastream.
ds - the datastream containing the datastream version.
dsv - the datastream version whose content is to be handled.
Returns:
the sink to which the caller should write the content, or null if the caller should not write the content. If non-null, the caller is expected to close the stream when finished writing the content to it.
Throws:
IOException - if the content cannot be handled for any reason.

close

void close()
Releases all resources associated with this handler. This can be safely called multiple times.
